required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Embedded Palliative Care in Managing Symptoms in Participants With Recurrent Stage III-IV Thoracic Malignancies and Their Caregivers
clinical_study.official_title: Embedded Palliative Care in the Management of Advanced Thoracic Malignancies

lead_sponsor.agency: Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center

clinical_study.source: Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center

brief_summary.textblock: This trial studies how well embedded palliative care works in managing symptoms in participants with stage III-IV thoracic malignancies that has come back and their caregivers. Embedded palliative care may improve distress and anxiety in participants and caregivers.

detailed_description.textblock:
PRIMARY OBJECTIVES:
I. To determine feasibility of embedding a palliative care (PC) physician within the James Thoracic Oncology Clinic.
II. To assess patient and caregiver outcomes over a 12-month period within an embedded onco-palliative care clinic model.
III. To evaluate and describe clinician attitudes and beliefs regarding utilization of embedded palliative care as well as symptoms of provider burnout.
IV. To analyze health care utilization among participants receiving embedded onco-palliative care.
OUTLINE:
Participants and caregivers undergo embedded palliative care comprising symptom management (physical and psychological), advanced directives and goals of care discussion, caregiver support, and referral for adjunctive supportive services as needed at each clinic visit.
After completion of study, patients are followed for up to 1 year.

primary_outcome.measure: Acceptance from providers to assess utilization of palliative care services
primary_outcome.description: Acceptance will be evaluated utilizing provider surveys (to capture provider opinions on palliative care utilization) as well as rate of enrollment. Preliminary data will be summarized and collected. Confidence intervals will also be calculated for feasibility rates.

primary_outcome.measure: Demand of palliative care services to be evaluated
primary_outcome.description: Preliminary data will be summarized and collected. Confidence intervals will also be calculated for feasibility rates.

primary_outcome.measure: Capacity and productivity to be evaluated
primary_outcome.description: Clinician capacity and productivity will be evaluated by looking at scheduling as well as billing productivity. Preliminary data will be summarized and collected. Confidence intervals will also be calculated for feasibility rates.

primary_outcome.measure: Resource assessment of staff and space
primary_outcome.description: Resources required, including patient care rooms and nursing support will also be evaluated. Preliminary data will be summarized and collected. Confidence intervals will also be calculated for feasibility rates.

primary_outcome.measure: Symptom burden (patient outcome) supportive care screen
primary_outcome.description: Will be assessed using Supportive care screen.

primary_outcome.measure: Symptom burden (patient outcome) Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-Lung
primary_outcome.description: Will be assessed using Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-Lung
Will be assessed using Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS)

primary_outcome.measure: Symptom burden using National Comprehensive Cancer Network distress thermometer (patient outcome)
primary_outcome.description: Will be assessed using National Comprehensive Cancer Network distress thermometer

primary_outcome.measure: Anxiety assessment using Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (patient outcome)
primary_outcome.description: Anxiety assessed using the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale

primary_outcome.measure: Depression assessment using Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (patient outcome)
primary_outcome.description: Depression assessed using the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale

primary_outcome.measure: Functional status assessed using Functional Activities Scale (patient outcome)
primary_outcome.description: Functional status assessment using Functional Activities Scale (FAS)

primary_outcome.measure: Health care service needs assessed using Supportive Care Needs Survey Partners and Caregivers (SCNS- P and C) (Caregiver outcome)
primary_outcome.description: Caregiver needs assessment using Supportive Care Needs Survey - Patients & Caregivers (SCNC-P&C)

primary_outcome.measure: Psychological/emotional needs assessed using SCNS- P and C (Caregiver outcome)
primary_outcome.description: Caregiver needs assessment using Supportive Care Needs Survey - Patients & Caregivers (SCNC-P&C)

primary_outcome.measure: Work/social needs assessed using SCNS- P and C (Caregiver outcome)
primary_outcome.description: Caregiver needs assessment using Supportive Care Needs Survey - Patients & Caregivers (SCNC-P&C)

primary_outcome.measure: Information needs assessed using SCNS- P and C (Caregiver outcome)
primary_outcome.description: Caregiver needs assessment using Supportive Care Needs Survey - Patients & Caregivers (SCNC-P&C)

primary_outcome.measure: Self-reported barriers and attitudes regarding palliative care assessed using Ohio State Palliative Care Provider Survey (Provider outcome)
primary_outcome.description: Ohio State Palliative Care Provider survey used to assess perceived barriers to referral
Will be captured using Integrated Health Information Systems electronic medical record data as well as patient reported events.

secondary_outcome.measure: Challenges for patients, caregivers, and the treating oncologist in an embedded palliative care model
secondary_outcome.description: evaluate the challenges for patients, caregivers and treating oncologist in embedded palliative care

clinical_study.condition: Stage III Lung Cancer AJCC v8
Stage IIIA Lung Cancer AJCC v8
Stage IIIB Lung Cancer AJCC v8
Stage IIIC Lung Cancer AJCC v8
Stage IV Lung Cancer AJCC v8
Stage IVA Lung Cancer AJCC v8
Stage IVB Lung Cancer AJCC v8

arm_group.description: Participants and caregivers undergo embedded palliative care comprising symptom management (physical and psychological), advanced directives and goals of care discussion, caregiver support, and referral for adjunctive supportive services as needed at each clinic visit.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with advanced or metastatic cancer of the chest (lung, thymus, or pleura): stage III or IV, recurrent disease
- Patients will receive therapy (chemotherapy, immunotherapy, targeted therapy or radiation therapy) at The Ohio State University
- New patients (defined as patients who have received no therapy for metastatic disease or have started treatment for metastatic disease within the last 30 days) or established patients with advanced cancer receiving anti-cancer therapy, no limit on prior therapies
- Patient and caregiver must be able to read and understand consent form
- Patients must designate a willing caregiver to participate although caregiver consent is not required for patient participation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are already enrolled or have been previously enrolled in palliative care or hospice services as an outpatient. Inpatient palliative care consultation prior to enrollment is permitted
- Patients who do not qualify for active anti-cancer therapy and opt to enroll in hospice services prior to study enrollment
- Patients who are unable to read or understand consent form
- Patients receiving primary systemic treatment outside of Ohio State. Outside radiation therapy is permitted
